items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have risen on the Upper River Wey as a result of recent heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads adjacent to the river is possible from this afternoon, 08/09/22, especially in the Passfield Mill area. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point.
Further heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 36 hours. We expect river levels to remain high today and tomorrow.
We are closely monitoring the situation. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 09/09/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Rythe from Oxshott to Thames Ditton
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message: This Flood Alert remains in force as heavy rain and thunderstorms may still affect the London area throughout Friday 9 September. While uncertainty remains around exact timings and which areas will experience the heaviest rain, it is possible that areas experiencing the heaviest showers could experience some flooding. River levels could rise quickly and overtop their banks, flooding to low lying land, roads and riverside gardens is possible. Surface water flooding may also impact areas affected by the heaviest showers. We recommend you monitor local weather conditions and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. We are monitoring the situation closely and have had staff out on the ground checking and clearing trash screens. We will update this message by 8pm Friday evening.
